description.narrative: Access to finance: MSMEs are a critical segment of the economy contributing 17% of GDP and responsible for 47% of total workforce in the Indian economy. At a time when most banks move to larger/safer credits, IFC''s dedicated MSME line will enable YES Bank to continue its program of reaching incremental MSMEs and agri customers. IFC''s credit line will deepen the partnership in this important market segment, enabling YES Bank to utilize its growing, high quality networks and execution capabilities to serve these high priority customers, which IFC cannot reach on its own. In addition, IFC funding will add the much needed resources to YES Bank''s MSME lending program enabling significant additional numbers of MSME and agri customers to be served. Expanding Network: YES Bank plans to grow its branch network from the present 500 branches to 600 branches in FY14 and 750 branches in FY15. A part of the expansion will be in the low income states, and the expansion will primarily focus on increasing the Bank''s MSME, agri and retail franchise, in order to diversify its client base and increase savings mobilization.

Founded in 2004, YES Bank Ltd. (YES Bank or the Bank) is the 4th largest private sector bank in India, with an asset base of c.US$18 billion (FY13). It has a widespread branch network of over 500 branches spread across 350 cities with more than 1100 ATMs. It is one of the fastest growing private sector banks, with the banks loan book growing at a CAGR of 38%, over the last 5 years. The Bank has steadily diversified and increased its SME and retail portfolio, which presently comprises 36% of its loan book. As part of its strategy, the Bank aspires to increase the proportion of the SMEs to 50% over the next five years.
